column1: Glad to be a part of the Greater Manlius Chamber of Commerce State of our Community last night to answer questions and talk with local residents. https://t.co/5gJvOeGkhb

Yesterday I voted in favor of the Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act— bipartisan & commonsense legislation that will level the playing field for older workers in CNY by restoring the ability to combat age discrimination in the workplace.  https://t.co/HKTvBrlNer

It was great meeting with Slovakia's Ambassador to the United States Ivan Korčok. We had a robust discussion regarding election security and the threat posed by foreign actors. https://t.co/KnvLdioPuX

I applaud @SecretaryCarson and @HUDgov for providing community organizations in Central New York with the necessary funds through the Continuum of Care Program to reduce homelessness in our region.   https://t.co/i0hSd55pm6

I was pleased to join the Friends of Ireland Caucus for a briefing from British Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab. We discussed Brexit and its implications on our nation’s relationship with the United Kingdom and Ireland. https://t.co/84qBduq5zS
It was great to join @TheSummitFCU and the @OnondagaSheriff to show our support for the Second Chance Canine Adoption Shelter. https://t.co/Fw5o8pXlHQ

Today I sent a letter to @SecretarySonny urging the @USDA to continue engaging with food security stakeholders to ensure individuals in CNY are not adversely impacted by new requirements for the Supplemental Nutrition assistance Program (SNAP). https://t.co/iEWOTJ0Qn7
https://t.co/p0wdogBthG

It was great meeting with Tim Saka from @CNYRISECENTER. We talked about issues facing Turkish-Americans in our community and how to better build relationships with the Turkish community in Central New York. https://t.co/UFvbWgkPnw
As we wait for dependable information to emerge I am praying for the safety of our troops and am monitoring the situation closely.

As Ranking Member of the Committee on Homeland Security’s Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection I am committed to keeping our nation safe from cyber threats and will continue to closely monitor the situation in the Middle East.   https://t.co/LznalHUJju

Help Needed! The U.S. Census Bureau is hiring. Help ensure Central New York is accurately counted in the upcoming census and apply for a job with the Census Bureau. For more information please follow the link below:  https://t.co/tNqx7C8A1V
Wishing a Merry Christmas to all celebrating in Central New York today! I hope you are able to take time to be with family and loved ones.  Stay safe and have a happy holiday. https://t.co/wlwuhzaNWs
I was pleased to visit with many bright CNY students today as they interview for nominations to the Unities States Military Service Academies. https://t.co/vX8nStppdn

Repealing the burdensome Medical Device Tax has been among my top priorities since I first came to Congress. I am pleased to announce that Congress has passed a permanent repeal of this tax. https://t.co/6X2e0c0YvW
https://t.co/gdIVOUkjBB

This morning in the Village of Fayetteville I announced the introduction of bipartisan legislation to name the Fayetteville Post Office in honor of World War II veteran Corporal George H. Bacel. https://t.co/uD32Sy7k5X
https://t.co/Mo0K7YyDQh
I have long advocated for expanding the depth of the Port of Oswego and am pleased to announce today that the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers will begin that process.  https://t.co/WBhwN0i0NR

It was great to meet with @adamputnam of @DucksUnlimited. We talked about my work to improve water quality in Central New York and the need to address our nation’s crumbling water infrastructure. https://t.co/MVUgO5wC2V
I was honored to work as a negotiator to produce a bipartisan bicameral NDAA conference report that contains key wins for Central New York. https://t.co/eX8zwqKE7U

@Prisoncitybeer Craft Breweries are a vital part of our Central New York economy and a testament to our region’s entrepreneurial spirit. I am proud to be a cosponsor of the Craft Beverage Modernization and Tax Reform Act and will continue working to advance this legislation.

It was great to join the @RedCross and the bipartisan Congressional Military Family Caucus to make holiday cards for servicemembers serving overseas. We are extremely grateful for the sacrifice made by members of our military and their families during the holiday season. https://t.co/WRB01QIviJ

Today marks the 78th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor. December 7 1941 will be a day that will forever live in infamy as we remember the thousands of Americans who lost their lives. https://t.co/o7rkHtBBsX

Robocalls continue to plague families and seniors across Central New York. This week I was proud to vote in favor of the TRACED Act bipartisan legislation that passed the House to combat the robocall epidemic. https://t.co/9Px0avHvQC

Congratulations to the new @SyracusePolice Officers who graduated from the Syracuse Regional Police Academy today. I applaud their decision to serve and protect our community and wish them all the best as they begin their careers in public service. https://t.co/CKuImJwrki

In response to the recently passed criminal justice reform bill in New York state I joined a bipartisan group of lawmakers in urging Governor Cuomo to protect law abiding citizens victims of crime and our already overburdened taxpayers. https://t.co/BT1F7uxfrV
https://t.co/vkon8lLl0m

I am pleased to see the bipartisan Preventing Animal Cruelty and Torture (PACT) Act signed into law— legislation I proudly supported which gives the Federal Government jurisdiction to protect animals from cruelty and torture. https://t.co/0IWx9nOLix

It is always a privilege to participate in the Onondaga County Adoption Day ceremony. Tomorrow marks National Adoption Day which is a national effort to raise awareness of the more than 100000 children in foster care waiting to find permanent loving families. https://t.co/HWsKePTF5t

Standing alongside local organizations committed to ending domestic violence and sexual assault in Onondaga Cayuga Wayne and Oswego Counties I announced the introduction of bipartisan legislation to prevent domestic violence and support survivors and their families. https://t.co/RkETuolugp

As the Ranking Member of the Homeland Security’s Subcommittee on Cybersecurity I gave opening remarks at a recent hearing on election interference. I am committed to developing innovative and bipartisan solutions to ensure Americans have full confidence in our electoral process. https://t.co/S0L8MKZt1R

Following a proposal this week from Major League Baseball (MLB) to eliminate 42 Minor League Baseball clubs including the @Doubledays I urged MLB Commissioner Robert Manfred to keep the Doubledays in Auburn.   https://t.co/T8NGSTZSfF
It was an honor to welcome my friend Harriet Tubman Home President & CEO Karen Hill to Washington yesterday and to join a bipartisan group in viewing the film "Harriet."  https://t.co/xHTV3zUFvD
I am proud to introduce the bipartisan Fair Access for Individuals to Receive (FAIR) Leave Act alongside @RepKatiePorter.   https://t.co/hG1fOjYWz1

The Onondaga County Korea/Vietnam Veterans Memorial serves as a living testimony for all those who served in these conflicts. On Veterans Day I stood alongside Vietnam and Korean War veterans to honor the brave men and women who gave their lives in defense of our nation. https://t.co/1KhQKEvPUr

I applaud the House for passing the VA Tele-Hearing Modernization Act bipartisan legislation I joined @RepCunningham in introducing to modernize the VA appeals process for Central New York veterans.   https://t.co/RWqVltUgLn

REMINDER: Students applying for a nomination to our Nation’s military service academies must submit a completed application packet to my office by this Friday November 15 2019. https://t.co/Qv08DEKDI1

It was a pleasure speaking at the Alzheimer’s Association breakfast. Seeing my father suffer from Alzheimer’s in the late stages of his life I understand the pain this neurological disorder causes families and caretakers. https://t.co/BE5jtDJiWn

I was proud to be in attendance for the Central New York Food Truck Association’s Veterans Pie Social at Loretto. This Veteran’s Day event honored over 50 veterans in our community who faithfully served our great nation. https://t.co/j6sCqDbWko

On Veterans Day I visited with veterans at the Camillus Ridge Terrace Retirement and Assisted Living Facility to present Congressional Certificates recognizing their service to our nation. https://t.co/L6mMlQIYCs
Always humbled and honored to be a part of the Onondaga County Veterans Day Observance. Thank you to our veterans for protecting and serving our great nation. https://t.co/nubGRpXS2C
Today on Veterans Day I would like to take a moment to honor those in our community and across our nation who have risked their lives to protect our freedom and democracy. https://t.co/DYdzwXrSgE

Always an honor to be a part of the CNY Veterans Parade and expo to kick off Veterans Day weekend.  Thank you to all of our brave veterans who have put their lives on the line for our nation’s freedom. https://t.co/S2lvwKmiKC
I joined @RepBrindisi and @RepJoeMorelle to urge the IJC act to protect our shoreline communities residents and businesses.   https://t.co/HA98ijmabi

Ahead of Veterans Day I was proud to present long overdue medals to three Central New York veterans and their families. It was my honor to work on behalf of these brave veterans and their families to secure these missing service awards. https://t.co/lQQEzXlWfI
It was great to be in attendance for the grand opening of the Rescue Mission’s Clarence L. Jordan Food Service and Culinary Education Center in Syracuse. https://t.co/bc0t0AAxLj

Glad to join @Syracuse1848 in honoring the @SyracusePolice at the annual Medal Ceremony to pay tribute to officers who risk their lives every day to protect our community. We are so grateful for their service. https://t.co/fyEo09cSI9
https://t.co/GfE4Lt4FKt
https://t.co/1Uz2hnLzXC

I am proud to announce the introduction of the bipartisan and bicameral Stop Importation and Manufacturing of Synthetic Analogues (SIMSA) Act to staunch the influx of deadly synthetic drugs in Central New York.   https://t.co/k0acu3nngV
Have a safe and happy Halloween! 🎃 https://t.co/F6SElgHqGW

Glad to announce $375000 in federal funds for the Syracuse Youth Substance Abuse Prevention Coalition (YSAP) Cayuga County Drug-Free Community Coalition (DFCC) and Oswego County Prevention Coalition to address youth substance abuse in Central New York.  https://t.co/Q1xvvAEVpu
https://t.co/zehYtSUiAV

Today the House Committee on Transportation & Infrastructure approved the bipartisan Water Quality Protection and Job Creation Act legislation I introduced to modernize our nation’s water infrastructure. https://t.co/EsEhUyTXSi

With my support tonight the House passed bipartisan legislation to require online e-cigarette retailers to verify the age of their customers. Like many parents in CNY I am deeply concerned that e-cigarettes and vapor products are falling into the hands of children and teens.

Good luck to @PatrickCorbin46 as he takes the mound for the @Nationals in Game 4 of the World Series— a Central New York native and Cicero- North Syracuse High School graduate I’ll be cheering him on tonight! https://t.co/ssXH8ESsmo

I believe we must work to overhaul water infrastructure in rural areas ensuring our community has access to reliable and safe drinking water. I applaud the @usda for enabling the Town of Rose to make upgrades to its current water system.   https://t.co/ycAPi9QSut
As co-chair of the bipartisan Mental Health Caucus I am proud to introduce The Seeding Rural Resilience alongside @RepBrindisi and @RepAngieCraig.   https://t.co/bS4ThJ2Zby

Excited to join @RepDelBene to launch the Internet of Things Caucus. This bipartisan caucus will focus on addressing the need to bolster security for connected devices and emerging technology. https://t.co/KdgMs5cReI

No woman should ever have to choose between working and raising their child. I am pleased that the @EdLaborGOP  is holding a hearing on my bipartisan bill the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act.  https://t.co/5eLpimUMmT

On December 21 1988 270 people including 35 @SyracuseU students and two @sunyoswego  students were killed on Pan-Am Flight 103. I will be keeping those who lost their lives and their families in my thoughts this week.   https://t.co/LNSnO1H0yU
It was a pleasure meeting with students from @sunyoswego’s Public Relations program today! https://t.co/eaUmEtxMTk

I was pleased to host a roundtable discussion on missing and murdered native women and sexual violence on tribal lands. We must work alongside tribal law enforcement and community organizations to prevent gender-based violence on tribal lands. https://t.co/vrgaAJLJ4v
I spoke on the House floor to honor Village of Hannibal Mayor Ronald K. Greenleaf who was recently named “Veteran of the Year” by the Oswego County Veterans Service Agency. https://t.co/w0H0sZXxUI

He was a tremendous advocate for this measure and in his memory I will continue our work to champion passage of this bill.  I wish Rep. Cummings’ family loved ones and constituents peace during this incredibly difficult time.

I am incredibly saddened to learn of the death of my colleague Elijah Cummings.  Since coming to Congress I’ve proudly partnered with Rep. Cummings in authoring bipartisan legislation to honor the life of Harriet Tubman and to memorialize her likeness on the $20 bill.

For this reason  I joined my colleagues in introducing legislation to impose sanctions against Turkey.  To eradicate global terrorists forces such as ISIS our nation must maintain its strong leadership role in the world and uphold its commitment to its allies.

With my support the House passed a bipartisan measure opposing the Administration’s recent action to withdraw troops from Northern Syria.   This decision has sparked a Turkish military offensive in the region against U.S.-allied Kurds.   https://t.co/ikDwtn18mq

I participated in the ribbon cutting for the newly opened @DeptVetAffairs veterans outpatient clinic in Auburn. This new facility will provide access to primary care diagnostic services and behavioral healthcare options for more than 1500 enrolled veterans. https://t.co/xFzS7DSL9q

I have worked in Congress to find innovative and bipartisan solutions to curbing and combating the high rate of suicide in our nation. If you or someone you know is having suicidal thoughts please know that there are resources available to help 24/7 at 800-273-TALK (8255).

I participated in the @afspnational Out of Darkness Walk at Long Branch Park this weekend to improve awareness of suicide prevention efforts and to raise funds for research education programs and support for victims of suicide loss. https://t.co/VlbxI9v9Cw

I spoke at the Cayuga County Farm Bureau’s Annual Dinner in Owasco. I talked about the need for trade deals that benefit CNY farmers as well as my efforts in Congress to increase farmers’ access to foreign markets improve crop insurance and renew the H-2B Visa program. https://t.co/DI5C6EEUVU

Glad to join Superintendent Kise of @SodusSchools in announcing $2.5 million in federal funding to address the shortage of mental health professionals in schools. https://t.co/kpp0IQsrfq

Excellent forum discussion @UpstateNews on the opioid epidemic in Central New York.  We must do more to prevent further opioid and heroin overdoses and ensure access to treatment for those struggling with addiction. https://t.co/1rEDHx3Gza

Always love dropping by the Auburn farmers market for fresh produce! https://t.co/M03WSUHocr

Thank you to the @AARP reps for stopping by my office. I remain committed to opposing cuts to Social Security and Medicare for current or soon-to-be retirees and will continue advocating for policies that ensure seniors have access to prescription drugs at affordable prices https://t.co/cpDuT5zWcb

Supporting efforts to improve our region’s mental healthcare has been among my top priorities in Congress and I’ve consistently advocated for funding to ensure our community is able to improve access to these vital services – especially for children.

I am determined to keep my promise to constituents working as a bipartisan representative focused on the issues that matter to Central New Yorkers.

In a Congress that continues to be plagued by hyper-partisanship and gridlock I am proud to have this legislation pass the House with overwhelming support from Representatives of both sides of the aisle.

My bill makes it easier for travelers to remedy these types of errors and once resolved Trusted Traveler enrollees who have had their status wrongly suspended will be provided an extension equivalent to the length of the wrongful delay.
For example if an innocent individual has the same name as a known or suspected terrorist he or she could have his or her Global Entry status revoked.
Currently if someone enrolled in this program has his or her status erroneously revoked or suspended reinstatement in the program is a costly and arduous process.
Tonight the House passed bipartisan legislation I authored to improve our trusted traveler programs – like TSA PreCheck. https://t.co/waVYNz6Ns1
But the refugee resettlement program has high standards and protections in place and abandoning it would go against our nation’s longstanding leadership in addressing the global refugee crisis.

The abrupt decision by Nancy Pelosi and House Democrats to begin impeachment proceedings without waiting for the facts is a dramatic overstep.

I served as a federal prosecutor for nearly 20 years and unequivocally believe in following the facts wherever they lead.  The full facts surrounding the President’s conversation with the Ukrainian President need to come out.

This measure establishes a competitive grant program so that states and local government can apply for federal funding to build safety nets and barriers on bridges and ensure that those already in place are effective.
